Mike Clark authored JUnitPerf, a set of very clean extensions to JUnit--I
would recommend his services as he has an excellent understanding of the
JUnit API and how to use it.

As a supplemental reference, you could check out the book "Java Tools for
Extreme Programming"

which provides in-depth tutorials on JUnit, Ant, and several Junit
extensions (including JunitPerf).

More details on the book:
http://www.rickhightower.com/JavaXPToolkit/
http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/047120708X/

-----Original Message-----
From: Mike Clark [mailto:mike@...]
Sent: Thursday, January 17, 2002 5:37 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Junit Training


kanti gowr wrote:

> Hi
>   Our QA Team is interested to get training in JUNIT(Our Application is
J2EE
> based),Can we know any institute which charges reasonable rates
>

I provide on-site JUnit training and mentoring services.  These services are
very much tailored to project-specific needs, class size, and
duration, rather than a one-size-fits-all training course.

Mike

--
Mike Clark
Clarkware Consulting, Inc.
